2912 return (true);
2913}
2914
2915/*%
2916 * IO timeout handler, used for both connect and recv timeouts. If
2917 * retries are still allowed, either resend the UDP packet or queue a
2918 * new TCP lookup. Otherwise, cancel the lookup.
2919 */
2920static void
2921connect_timeout(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event) {
2922 dig_lookup_t *l = NULL;
2923 dig_query_t *query = NULL;
2924
2925 UNUSED(task);
2926 REQUIRE(event->ev_type == ISC_TIMEREVENT_IDLE);
2927
2928 debug("connect_timeout()");
2929
2930 LOCK_LOOKUP;
2931 query = event->ev_arg;
2932 REQUIRE(DIG_VALID_QUERY(query));
2933 l = query->lookup;
2934 isc_event_free(&event);
2935
2936 INSIST(!free_now);
2937
2938 if (cancel_now) {
2939 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
2940 return;
2941 }
2942
2943 if (try_next_server(l)) {
2944 if (l->tcp_mode) {
2945 if (query->sock != NULL) {
2946 isc_socket_cancel(query->sock, NULL,
2947 ISC_SOCKCANCEL_ALL);
2948 } else {
2949 clear_query(query);
2950 }
2951 }
2952 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
2953 return;
2954 }
2955
2956 if (l->tcp_mode && query->sock != NULL) {
2957 query->timedout = true;
2958 isc_socket_cancel(query->sock, NULL, ISC_SOCKCANCEL_ALL);
2959 }
2960
2961 if (l->retries > 1) {
2962 if (!l->tcp_mode) {
2963 l->retries--;
2964 debug("resending UDP request to first server");
2965 send_udp(ISC_LIST_HEAD(l->q));
2966 } else {
2967 debug("making new TCP request, %d tries left",
2968 l->retries);
2969 l->retries--;
2970 requeue_lookup(l, true);
2971 cancel_lookup(l);
2972 check_next_lookup(l);
2973 }
2974 } else {
2975 if (l->ns_search_only) {
2976 isc_netaddr_t netaddr;
2977 char buf[ISC_NETADDR_FORMATSIZE];
2978
2979 isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(&netaddr, &query->sockaddr);
2980 isc_netaddr_format(&netaddr, buf, sizeof(buf));
2981
2982 printf(";; no response from %s\n", buf);
2983 } else {
2984 fputs(l->cmdline, stdout);
2985 printf(";; connection timed out; no servers could be "
2986 "reached\n");
2987 }
2988 cancel_lookup(l);
2989 check_next_lookup(l);
2990 if (exitcode < 9)
2991 exitcode = 9;
2992 }
2993 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
2994}
2995
2996/*%
2997 * Called when a peer closes a TCP socket prematurely.
2998 */
2999static void
3000requeue_or_update_exitcode(dig_lookup_t *lookup) {
3001 if (lookup->eoferr == 0U) {
3002 /*
3003 * Peer closed the connection prematurely for the first time
3004 * for this lookup. Try again, keeping track of this failure.
3005 */
3006 dig_lookup_t *requeued_lookup = requeue_lookup(lookup, true);
3007 requeued_lookup->eoferr++;
3008 } else {
3009 /*
3010 * Peer closed the connection prematurely and it happened
3011 * previously for this lookup. Indicate an error.
3012 */
3013 exitcode = 9;
3014 }
3015}
3016
3017/*%
3018 * Event handler for the TCP recv which gets the length header of TCP
3019 * packets. Start the next recv of length bytes.
3020 */
3021static void
3022tcp_length_done(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event) {
3023 isc_socketevent_t *sevent;
3024 isc_buffer_t b;
3025 isc_region_t r;
3026 isc_result_t result;
3027 dig_query_t *query = NULL;
3028 dig_lookup_t *l;
3029 uint16_t length;
3030
3031 REQUIRE(event->ev_type == ISC_SOCKEVENT_RECVDONE);
3032 INSIST(!free_now);
3033
3034 UNUSED(task);
3035
3036 debug("tcp_length_done()");
3037
3038 LOCK_LOOKUP;
3039 sevent = (isc_socketevent_t *)event;
3040 query = event->ev_arg;
3041 REQUIRE(DIG_VALID_QUERY(query));
3042
3043 recvcount--;
3044 INSIST(recvcount >= 0);
3045
3046 if (sevent->result == ISC_R_CANCELED) {
3047 isc_event_free(&event);
3048 l = query->lookup;
3049 clear_query(query);
3050 check_next_lookup(l);
3051 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
3052 return;
3053 }
3054 if (sevent->result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3055 char sockstr[ISC_SOCKADDR_FORMATSIZE];
3056 isc_sockaddr_format(&query->sockaddr, sockstr,
3057 sizeof(sockstr));
3058 printf(";; communications error to %s: %s\n",
3059 sockstr, isc_result_totext(sevent->result));
3060 if (keep != NULL)
3061 isc_socket_detach(&keep);
3062 l = query->lookup;
3063 isc_socket_detach(&query->sock);
3064 sockcount--;
3065 debug("sockcount=%d", sockcount);
3066 INSIST(sockcount >= 0);
3067 if (sevent->result == ISC_R_EOF) {
3068 requeue_or_update_exitcode(l);
3069 }
3070 isc_event_free(&event);
3071 clear_query(query);
3072 cancel_lookup(l);
3073 check_next_lookup(l);
3074 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
3075 return;
3076 }
3077 isc_buffer_init(&b, sevent->region.base, sevent->n);
3078 isc_buffer_add(&b, sevent->n);
3079 length = isc_buffer_getuint16(&b);
3080
3081 if (length == 0) {
3082 isc_event_free(&event);
3083 launch_next_query(query, false);
3084 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
3085 return;
3086 }
3087
3088 /*
3089 * Even though the buffer was already init'ed, we need
3090 * to redo it now, to force the length we want.
3091 */
3092 isc_buffer_invalidate(&query->recvbuf);
3093 isc_buffer_init(&query->recvbuf, query->recvspace, length);
3094 isc_buffer_availableregion(&query->recvbuf, &r);
3095 debug("recving with lookup=%p, query=%p", query->lookup, query);
3096 result = isc_socket_recv(query->sock, &r, length, task,
3097 recv_done, query);
3098 check_result(result, "isc_socket_recv");
3099 recvcount++;
3100 debug("resubmitted recv request with length %d, recvcount=%d",
3101 length, recvcount);
3102 isc_event_free(&event);
3103 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
3104}
3105
3106/*%
3107 * For transfers that involve multiple recvs (XFR's in particular),
3108 * launch the next recv.
3109 */
3110static void
3111launch_next_query(dig_query_t *query, bool include_question) {
3112 isc_result_t result;
3113 dig_lookup_t *l;
3114 isc_region_t r;
3115 REQUIRE(DIG_VALID_QUERY(query));
3116
3117 INSIST(!free_now);
3118
3119 debug("launch_next_query()");
3120
3121 if (!query->lookup->pending) {
3122 debug("ignoring launch_next_query because !pending");
3123 isc_socket_detach(&query->sock);
3124 sockcount--;
3125 debug("sockcount=%d", sockcount);
3126 INSIST(sockcount >= 0);
3127 query->waiting_connect = false;
3128 l = query->lookup;
3129 clear_query(query);
3130 check_next_lookup(l);
3131 return;
3132 }
3133
3134 isc_buffer_clear(&query->lengthbuf);
3135 isc_buffer_availableregion(&query->lengthbuf, &r);
3136 result = isc_socket_recv(query->sock, &r, 0,
3137 global_task, tcp_length_done, query);
3138 check_result(result, "isc_socket_recv");
3139 recvcount++;
3140 debug("recvcount=%d", recvcount);
3141 if (!query->first_soa_rcvd) {
3142 debug("sending a request in launch_next_query");
3143 TIME_NOW(&query->time_sent);
3144 query->waiting_senddone = true;
3145 isc_buffer_clear(&query->tmpsendbuf);
3146 isc_buffer_putuint16(&query->tmpsendbuf,
3147 isc_buffer_usedlength(&query->sendbuf));
3148 if (include_question) {
3149 isc_buffer_usedregion(&query->sendbuf, &r);
3150 isc_buffer_copyregion(&query->tmpsendbuf, &r);
3151 }
3152 isc_buffer_usedregion(&query->tmpsendbuf, &r);
3153 result = isc_socket_send(query->sock, &r,
3154 global_task, send_done, query);
3155 check_result(result, "isc_socket_send");
3156 sendcount++;
3157 debug("sendcount=%d", sendcount);
3158 }
3159 query->waiting_connect = false;
3160#if 0
3161 check_next_lookup(query->lookup);
3162#endif
3163 return;
3164}
3165
3166/*%
3167 * Event handler for TCP connect complete. Make sure the connection was
3168 * successful, then pass into launch_next_query to actually send the
3169 * question.
3170 */
3171static void
3172connect_done(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event) {
3173 char sockstr[ISC_SOCKADDR_FORMATSIZE];
3174 isc_socketevent_t *sevent = NULL;
3175 dig_query_t *query = NULL, *next;
3176 dig_lookup_t *l;
3177
3178 UNUSED(task);
3179
3180 REQUIRE(event->ev_type == ISC_SOCKEVENT_CONNECT);
3181 INSIST(!free_now);
3182
3183 debug("connect_done()");
3184
3185 LOCK_LOOKUP;
3186 sevent = (isc_socketevent_t *)event;
3187 query = sevent->ev_arg;
3188 REQUIRE(DIG_VALID_QUERY(query));
3189
3190 INSIST(query->waiting_connect);
3191
3192 query->waiting_connect = false;
3193
3194 if (sevent->result == ISC_R_CANCELED) {
3195 debug("in cancel handler");
3196 isc_sockaddr_format(&query->sockaddr, sockstr, sizeof(sockstr));
3197 if (query->timedout)
3198 printf(";; Connection to %s(%s) for %s failed: %s.\n",
3199 sockstr, query->servname,
3200 query->lookup->textname,
3201 isc_result_totext(ISC_R_TIMEDOUT));
3202 isc_socket_detach(&query->sock);
3203 INSIST(sockcount > 0);
3204 sockcount--;
3205 debug("sockcount=%d", sockcount);
3206 query->waiting_connect = false;
3207 isc_event_free(&event);
3208 l = query->lookup;
3209 clear_query(query);
3210 check_next_lookup(l);
3211 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
3212 return;
3213 }
3214 if (sevent->result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3215
3216 debug("unsuccessful connection: %s",
3217 isc_result_totext(sevent->result));
3218 isc_sockaddr_format(&query->sockaddr, sockstr, sizeof(sockstr));
3219 if (sevent->result != ISC_R_CANCELED)
3220 printf(";; Connection to %s(%s) for %s failed: "
3221 "%s.\n", sockstr,
3222 query->servname, query->lookup->textname,
3223 isc_result_totext(sevent->result));
3224 isc_socket_detach(&query->sock);
3225 INSIST(sockcount > 0);
3226 sockcount--;
3227 /* XXX Clean up exitcodes */
3228 if (exitcode < 9)
3229 exitcode = 9;
3230 debug("sockcount=%d", sockcount);
3231 query->waiting_connect = false;
3232 isc_event_free(&event);
3233 l = query->lookup;
3234 if ((l->current_query != NULL) &&
3235 (ISC_LINK_LINKED(l->current_query, link)))
3236 next = ISC_LIST_NEXT(l->current_query, link);
3237 else
3238 next = NULL;
3239 clear_query(query);
3240 if (next != NULL) {
3241 bringup_timer(next, TCP_TIMEOUT);
3242 send_tcp_connect(next);
3243 } else
3244 check_next_lookup(l);
3245 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
3246 return;
3247 }
3248 exitcode = 0;
3249 if (keep_open) {
3250 if (keep != NULL)
3251 isc_socket_detach(&keep);
3252 isc_socket_attach(query->sock, &keep);
3253 keepaddr = query->sockaddr;
3254 }
3255 launch_next_query(query, true);
3256 isc_event_free(&event);
3257 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
3258}
3259
3260/*%
3261 * Check if the ongoing XFR needs more data before it's complete, using
3262 * the semantics of IXFR and AXFR protocols. Much of the complexity of
3263 * this routine comes from determining when an IXFR is complete.
3264 * false means more data is on the way, and the recv has been issued.
3265 */
3266static bool
3267check_for_more_data(dig_query_t *query, dns_message_t *msg,
3268 isc_socketevent_t *sevent)
3269{
3270 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset = NULL;
3271 dns_rdata_t rdata = DNS_RDATA_INIT;
3272 dns_rdata_soa_t soa;
3273 uint32_t ixfr_serial = query->lookup->ixfr_serial, serial;
3274 isc_result_t result;
3275 bool ixfr = query->lookup->rdtype == dns_rdatatype_ixfr;
3276 bool axfr = query->lookup->rdtype == dns_rdatatype_axfr;
3277
3278 if (ixfr)
3279 axfr = query->ixfr_axfr;
3280
3281 debug("check_for_more_data()");
3282
3283 /*
3284 * By the time we're in this routine, we know we're doing
3285 * either an AXFR or IXFR. If there's no second_rr_type,
3286 * then we don't yet know which kind of answer we got back
3287 * from the server. Here, we're going to walk through the
3288 * rr's in the message, acting as necessary whenever we hit
3289 * an SOA rr.
3290 */
3291
3292 query->msg_count++;
3293 query->byte_count += sevent->n;
3294 result = dns_message_firstname(msg, DNS_SECTION_ANSWER);
3295 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3296 puts("; Transfer failed.");
3297 return (true);
3298 }
3299 do {
3300 dns_name_t *name;
3301 name = NULL;
3302 dns_message_currentname(msg, DNS_SECTION_ANSWER,
3303 &name);
3304 for (rdataset = ISC_LIST_HEAD(name->list);
3305 rdataset != NULL;
3306 rdataset = ISC_LIST_NEXT(rdataset, link)) {
3307 result = dns_rdataset_first(rdataset);
3308 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
3309 continue;
3310 do {
3311 query->rr_count++;
3312 dns_rdata_reset(&rdata);
3313 dns_rdataset_current(rdataset, &rdata);
3314 /*
3315 * If this is the first rr, make sure
3316 * it's an SOA
3317 */
3318 if ((!query->first_soa_rcvd) &&
3319 (rdata.type != dns_rdatatype_soa)) {
3320 puts("; Transfer failed. "
3321 "Didn't start with SOA answer.");
3322 return (true);
3323 }
3324 if ((!query->second_rr_rcvd) &&
3325 (rdata.type != dns_rdatatype_soa)) {
3326 query->second_rr_rcvd = true;
3327 query->second_rr_serial = 0;
3328 debug("got the second rr as nonsoa");
3329 axfr = query->ixfr_axfr = true;
3330 goto next_rdata;
3331 }
3332
3333 /*
3334 * If the record is anything except an SOA
3335 * now, just continue on...
3336 */
3337 if (rdata.type != dns_rdatatype_soa)
3338 goto next_rdata;
3339
3340 /* Now we have an SOA. Work with it. */
3341 debug("got an SOA");
3342 result = dns_rdata_tostruct(&rdata, &soa, NULL);
3343 check_result(result, "dns_rdata_tostruct");
3344 serial = soa.serial;
3345 dns_rdata_freestruct(&soa);
3346 if (!query->first_soa_rcvd) {
3347 query->first_soa_rcvd = true;
3348 query->first_rr_serial = serial;
3349 debug("this is the first serial %u",
3350 serial);
3351 if (ixfr && isc_serial_ge(ixfr_serial,
3352 serial)) {
3353 debug("got up to date "
3354 "response");
3355 goto doexit;
3356 }
3357 goto next_rdata;
3358 }
3359 if (axfr) {
3360 debug("doing axfr, got second SOA");
3361 goto doexit;
3362 }
3363 if (!query->second_rr_rcvd) {
3364 if (query->first_rr_serial == serial) {
3365 debug("doing ixfr, got "
3366 "empty zone");
3367 goto doexit;
3368 }
3369 debug("this is the second serial %u",
3370 serial);
3371 query->second_rr_rcvd = true;
3372 query->second_rr_serial = serial;
3373 goto next_rdata;
3374 }
3375 /*
3376 * If we get to this point, we're doing an
3377 * IXFR and have to start really looking
3378 * at serial numbers.
3379 */
3380 if (query->first_rr_serial == serial) {
3381 debug("got a match for ixfr");
3382 if (!query->first_repeat_rcvd) {
3383 query->first_repeat_rcvd =
3384 true;
3385 goto next_rdata;
3386 }
3387 debug("done with ixfr");
3388 goto doexit;
3389 }
3390 debug("meaningless soa %u", serial);
3391 next_rdata:
3392 result = dns_rdataset_next(rdataset);
3393 } while (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
3394 }
3395 result = dns_message_nextname(msg, DNS_SECTION_ANSWER);
3396 } while (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
3397 launch_next_query(query, false);
3398 return (false);
3399 doexit:
3400 dighost_received(sevent->n, &sevent->address, query);
3401 return (true);
3402}
3403
3404static void
3405process_cookie(dig_lookup_t *l, dns_message_t *msg,
3406 isc_buffer_t *optbuf, size_t optlen)
3407{
3408 char bb[256];
3409 isc_buffer_t hexbuf;
3410 size_t len;
3411 const unsigned char *sent;
3412 bool copy = true;
3413 isc_result_t result;
3414
3415 if (l->cookie != NULL) {
3416 isc_buffer_init(&hexbuf, bb, sizeof(bb));
3417 result = isc_hex_decodestring(l->cookie, &hexbuf);
3418 check_result(result, "isc_hex_decodestring");
3419 sent = isc_buffer_base(&hexbuf);
3420 len = isc_buffer_usedlength(&hexbuf);
3421 } else {
3422 sent = cookie;
3423 len = sizeof(cookie);
3424 }
3425
3426 INSIST(msg->cc_ok == 0 && msg->cc_bad == 0);
3427 if (len >= 8 && optlen >= 8U) {
3428 if (isc_safe_memequal(isc_buffer_current(optbuf), sent, 8)) {
3429 msg->cc_ok = 1;
3430 } else {
3431 printf(";; Warning: Client COOKIE mismatch\n");
3432 msg->cc_bad = 1;
3433 copy = false;
3434 }
3435 } else {
3436 printf(";; Warning: COOKIE bad token (too short)\n");
3437 msg->cc_bad = 1;
3438 copy = false;
3439 }
3440 if (copy) {
3441 isc_region_t r;
3442
3443 r.base = isc_buffer_current(optbuf);
3444 r.length = (unsigned int)optlen;
3445 isc_buffer_init(&hexbuf, servercookie, sizeof(servercookie));
3446 result = isc_hex_totext(&r, 2, "", &hexbuf);
3447 check_result(result, "isc_hex_totext");
3448 if (isc_buffer_availablelength(&hexbuf) > 0) {
3449 isc_buffer_putuint8(&hexbuf, 0);
3450 l->cookie = servercookie;
3451 }
3452 }
3453 isc_buffer_forward(optbuf, (unsigned int)optlen);
3454}
3455
3456static void
3457process_opt(dig_lookup_t *l, dns_message_t *msg) {
3458 dns_rdata_t rdata;
3459 isc_result_t result;
3460 isc_buffer_t optbuf;
3461 uint16_t optcode, optlen;
3462 dns_rdataset_t *opt = msg->opt;
3463 bool seen_cookie = false;
3464
3465 result = dns_rdataset_first(opt);
3466 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3467 dns_rdata_init(&rdata);
3468 dns_rdataset_current(opt, &rdata);
3469 isc_buffer_init(&optbuf, rdata.data, rdata.length);
3470 isc_buffer_add(&optbuf, rdata.length);
3471 while (isc_buffer_remaininglength(&optbuf) >= 4) {
3472 optcode = isc_buffer_getuint16(&optbuf);
3473 optlen = isc_buffer_getuint16(&optbuf);
3474 switch (optcode) {
3475 case DNS_OPT_COOKIE:
3476 /*
3477 * Only process the first cookie option.
3478 */
3479 if (seen_cookie) {
3480 isc_buffer_forward(&optbuf, optlen);
3481 break;
3482 }
3483 process_cookie(l, msg, &optbuf, optlen);
3484 seen_cookie = true;
3485 break;
3486 default:
3487 isc_buffer_forward(&optbuf, optlen);
3488 break;
3489 }
3490 }
3491 }
3492}
3493
3494static int
3495ednsvers(dns_rdataset_t *opt) {
3496 return ((opt->ttl >> 16) & 0xff);
3497}
3498
3499/*%
3500 * Event handler for recv complete. Perform whatever actions are necessary,
3501 * based on the specifics of the user's request.
3502 */
3503static void
3504recv_done(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event) {
3505 isc_socketevent_t *sevent = NULL;
3506 isc_region_t r;
3507 dig_query_t *query = NULL;
3508 isc_buffer_t b;
3509 dns_message_t *msg = NULL;
3510 isc_result_t result;
3511 dig_lookup_t *n, *l;
3512 bool docancel = false;
3513 bool match = true;
3514 bool done_process_opt = false;
3515 unsigned int parseflags;
3516 dns_messageid_t id;
3517 unsigned int msgflags;
3518 int newedns;
3519
3520 UNUSED(task);
3521 INSIST(!free_now);
3522
3523 debug("recv_done()");
3524
3525 LOCK_LOOKUP;
3526 recvcount--;
3527 debug("recvcount=%d", recvcount);
3528 INSIST(recvcount >= 0);
3529
3530 query = event->ev_arg;
3531 TIME_NOW(&query->time_recv);
3532 debug("lookup=%p, query=%p", query->lookup, query);
3533
3534 l = query->lookup;
3535
3536 REQUIRE(event->ev_type == ISC_SOCKEVENT_RECVDONE);
3537 sevent = (isc_socketevent_t *)event;
3538
3539 isc_buffer_init(&b, sevent->region.base, sevent->n);
3540 isc_buffer_add(&b, sevent->n);
3541
3542 if ((l->tcp_mode) && (query->timer != NULL))
3543 isc_timer_touch(query->timer);
3544 if ((!l->pending && !l->ns_search_only) || cancel_now) {
3545 debug("no longer pending. Got %s",
3546 isc_result_totext(sevent->result));
3547 query->waiting_connect = false;
3548
3549 isc_event_free(&event);
3550 clear_query(query);
3551 check_next_lookup(l);
3552 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
3553 return;
3554 }
3555
3556 if (sevent->result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3557 if (sevent->result == ISC_R_CANCELED) {
3558 debug("in recv cancel handler");
3559 query->waiting_connect = false;
3560 } else {
3561 printf(";; communications error: %s\n",
3562 isc_result_totext(sevent->result));
3563 if (keep != NULL)
3564 isc_socket_detach(&keep);
3565 isc_socket_detach(&query->sock);
3566 sockcount--;
3567 debug("sockcount=%d", sockcount);
3568 INSIST(sockcount >= 0);
3569 }
3570 if (sevent->result == ISC_R_EOF) {
3571 requeue_or_update_exitcode(l);
3572 }
3573 isc_event_free(&event);
3574 clear_query(query);
3575 cancel_lookup(l);
3576 check_next_lookup(l);
3577 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
3578 return;
3579 }
3580
3581 if (!l->tcp_mode &&
3582 !isc_sockaddr_compare(&sevent->address, &query->sockaddr,
3583 ISC_SOCKADDR_CMPADDR|
3584 ISC_SOCKADDR_CMPPORT|
3585 ISC_SOCKADDR_CMPSCOPE|
3586 ISC_SOCKADDR_CMPSCOPEZERO)) {
3587 char buf1[ISC_SOCKADDR_FORMATSIZE];
3588 char buf2[ISC_SOCKADDR_FORMATSIZE];
3589 isc_sockaddr_t any;
3590
3591 if (isc_sockaddr_pf(&query->sockaddr) == AF_INET)
3592 isc_sockaddr_any(&any);
3593 else
3594 isc_sockaddr_any6(&any);
3595
3596 /*
3597 * We don't expect a match when the packet is
3598 * sent to 0.0.0.0, :: or to a multicast addresses.
3599 * XXXMPA broadcast needs to be handled here as well.
3600 */
3601 if ((!isc_sockaddr_eqaddr(&query->sockaddr, &any) &&
3602 !isc_sockaddr_ismulticast(&query->sockaddr)) ||
3603 isc_sockaddr_getport(&query->sockaddr) !=
3604 isc_sockaddr_getport(&sevent->address)) {
3605 isc_sockaddr_format(&sevent->address, buf1,
3606 sizeof(buf1));
3607 isc_sockaddr_format(&query->sockaddr, buf2,
3608 sizeof(buf2));
3609 printf(";; reply from unexpected source: %s,"
3610 " expected %s\n", buf1, buf2);
3611 match = false;
3612 }
3613 }
3614
3615 result = dns_message_peekheader(&b, &id, &msgflags);
3616 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS || l->sendmsg->id != id) {
3617 match = false;
3618 if (l->tcp_mode) {
3619 bool fail = true;
3620 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3621 if (!query->first_soa_rcvd ||
3622 query->warn_id)
3623 printf(";; %s: ID mismatch: "
3624 "expected ID %u, got %u\n",
3625 query->first_soa_rcvd ?
3626 "WARNING" : "ERROR",
3627 l->sendmsg->id, id);
3628 if (query->first_soa_rcvd)
3629 fail = false;
3630 query->warn_id = false;
3631 } else
3632 printf(";; ERROR: short "
3633 "(< header size) message\n");
3634 if (fail) {
3635 isc_event_free(&event);
3636 clear_query(query);
3637 cancel_lookup(l);
3638 check_next_lookup(l);
3639 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
3640 return;
3641 }
3642 match = true;
3643 } else if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
3644 printf(";; Warning: ID mismatch: "
3645 "expected ID %u, got %u\n", l->sendmsg->id, id);
3646 else
3647 printf(";; Warning: short "
3648 "(< header size) message received\n");
3649 }
3650
3651 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS && (msgflags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_QR) == 0)
3652 printf(";; Warning: query response not set\n");
3653
3654 if (!match)
3655 goto udp_mismatch;
3656
3657 result = dns_message_create(mctx, DNS_MESSAGE_INTENTPARSE, &msg);
3658 check_result(result, "dns_message_create");
3659
3660 if (tsigkey != NULL) {
3661 if (l->querysig == NULL) {
3662 debug("getting initial querysig");
3663 result = dns_message_getquerytsig(l->sendmsg, mctx,
3664 &l->querysig);
3665 check_result(result, "dns_message_getquerytsig");
3666 }
3667 result = dns_message_setquerytsig(msg, l->querysig);
3668 check_result(result, "dns_message_setquerytsig");
3669 result = dns_message_settsigkey(msg, tsigkey);
3670 check_result(result, "dns_message_settsigkey");
3671 msg->tsigctx = l->tsigctx;
3672 l->tsigctx = NULL;
3673 if (l->msgcounter != 0)
3674 msg->tcp_continuation = 1;
3675 l->msgcounter++;
3676 }
3677
3678 debug("before parse starts");
3679 parseflags = DNS_MESSAGEPARSE_PRESERVEORDER;
3680 if (l->besteffort) {
3681 parseflags |= DNS_MESSAGEPARSE_BESTEFFORT;
3682 parseflags |= DNS_MESSAGEPARSE_IGNORETRUNCATION;
3683 }
3684 result = dns_message_parse(msg, &b, parseflags);
3685 if (result == DNS_R_RECOVERABLE) {
3686 printf(";; Warning: Message parser reports malformed "
3687 "message packet.\n");
3688 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
3689 }
3690 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3691 printf(";; Got bad packet: %s\n", isc_result_totext(result));
3692 hex_dump(&b);
3693 query->waiting_connect = false;
3694 dns_message_destroy(&msg);
3695 isc_event_free(&event);
3696 clear_query(query);
3697 cancel_lookup(l);
3698 check_next_lookup(l);
3699 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
3700 return;
3701 }
3702 if (msg->counts[DNS_SECTION_QUESTION] != 0) {
3703 match = true;
3704 for (result = dns_message_firstname(msg, DNS_SECTION_QUESTION);
3705 result == ISC_R_SUCCESS && match;
3706 result = dns_message_nextname(msg, DNS_SECTION_QUESTION)) {
3707 dns_name_t *name = NULL;
3708 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset;
3709
3710 dns_message_currentname(msg, DNS_SECTION_QUESTION,
3711 &name);
3712 for (rdataset = ISC_LIST_HEAD(name->list);
3713 rdataset != NULL;
3714 rdataset = ISC_LIST_NEXT(rdataset, link)) {
3715 if (l->rdtype != rdataset->type ||
3716 l->rdclass != rdataset->rdclass ||
3717 !dns_name_equal(l->name, name)) {
3718 char namestr[DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE];
3719 char typebuf[DNS_RDATATYPE_FORMATSIZE];
3720 char classbuf[DNS_RDATACLASS_FORMATSIZE];
3721 dns_name_format(name, namestr,
3722 sizeof(namestr));
3723 dns_rdatatype_format(rdataset->type,
3724 typebuf,
3725 sizeof(typebuf));
3726 dns_rdataclass_format(rdataset->rdclass,
3727 classbuf,
3728 sizeof(classbuf));
3729 printf(";; Question section mismatch: "
3730 "got %s/%s/%s\n",
3731 namestr, typebuf, classbuf);
3732 match = false;
3733 }
3734 }
3735 }
3736 if (!match) {
3737 dns_message_destroy(&msg);
3738 if (l->tcp_mode) {
3739 isc_event_free(&event);
3740 clear_query(query);
3741 cancel_lookup(l);
3742 check_next_lookup(l);
3743 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
3744 return;
3745 } else
3746 goto udp_mismatch;
3747 }
3748 }
3749 if (msg->rcode == dns_rcode_badvers && msg->opt != NULL &&
3750 (newedns = ednsvers(msg->opt)) < l->edns && l->ednsneg) {
3751 /*
3752 * Add minimum EDNS version required checks here if needed.
3753 */
3754 if (l->comments)
3755 printf(";; BADVERS, retrying with EDNS version %u.\n",
3756 (unsigned int)newedns);
3757 l->edns = newedns;
3758 n = requeue_lookup(l, true);
3759 if (l->trace && l->trace_root)
3760 n->rdtype = l->qrdtype;
3761 dns_message_destroy(&msg);
3762 isc_event_free(&event);
3763 clear_query(query);
3764 cancel_lookup(l);
3765 check_next_lookup(l);
3766 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
3767 return;
3768 }
3769 if ((msg->flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_TC) != 0 &&
3770 !l->ignore && !l->tcp_mode) {
3771 if (l->cookie == NULL && l->sendcookie && msg->opt != NULL)
3772 process_opt(l, msg);
3773 if (l->comments)
3774 printf(";; Truncated, retrying in TCP mode.\n");
3775 n = requeue_lookup(l, true);
3776 n->tcp_mode = true;
3777 if (l->trace && l->trace_root)
3778 n->rdtype = l->qrdtype;
3779 dns_message_destroy(&msg);
3780 isc_event_free(&event);
3781 clear_query(query);
3782 cancel_lookup(l);
3783 check_next_lookup(l);
3784 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
3785 return;
3786 }
3787 if (msg->rcode == dns_rcode_badcookie && !l->tcp_mode &&
3788 l->sendcookie && l->badcookie) {
3789 process_opt(l, msg);
3790 if (msg->cc_ok) {
3791 if (l->comments)
3792 printf(";; BADCOOKIE, retrying%s.\n",
3793 l->seenbadcookie ? " in TCP mode" : "");
3794 n = requeue_lookup(l, true);
3795 if (l->seenbadcookie)
3796 n->tcp_mode = true;
3797 n->seenbadcookie = true;
3798 if (l->trace && l->trace_root)
3799 n->rdtype = l->qrdtype;
3800 dns_message_destroy(&msg);
3801 isc_event_free(&event);
3802 clear_query(query);
3803 cancel_lookup(l);
3804 check_next_lookup(l);
3805 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
3806 return;
3807 }
3808 done_process_opt = true;
3809 }
3810 if ((msg->rcode == dns_rcode_servfail && !l->servfail_stops) ||
3811 (check_ra && (msg->flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_RA) == 0 && l->recurse))
3812 {
3813 dig_query_t *next = ISC_LIST_NEXT(query, link);
3814 if (l->current_query == query)
3815 l->current_query = NULL;
3816 if (next != NULL) {
3817 debug("sending query %p\n", next);
3818 if (l->tcp_mode)
3819 send_tcp_connect(next);
3820 else
3821 send_udp(next);
3822 }
3823 /*
3824 * If our query is at the head of the list and there
3825 * is no next, we're the only one left, so fall
3826 * through to print the message.
3827 */
3828 if ((ISC_LIST_HEAD(l->q) != query) ||
3829 (ISC_LIST_NEXT(query, link) != NULL)) {
3830 if (l->comments)
3831 printf(";; Got %s from %s, "
3832 "trying next server\n",
3833 msg->rcode == dns_rcode_servfail ?
3834 "SERVFAIL reply" :
3835 "recursion not available",
3836 query->servname);
3837 clear_query(query);
3838 check_next_lookup(l);
3839 dns_message_destroy(&msg);
3840 isc_event_free(&event);
3841 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
3842 return;
3843 }
3844 }
3845
3846 if (tsigkey != NULL) {
3847 result = dns_tsig_verify(&b, msg, NULL, NULL);
3848 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3849 printf(";; Couldn't verify signature: %s\n",
3850 isc_result_totext(result));
3851 validated = false;
3852 }
3853 l->tsigctx = msg->tsigctx;
3854 msg->tsigctx = NULL;
3855 if (l->querysig != NULL) {
3856 debug("freeing querysig buffer %p", l->querysig);
3857 isc_buffer_free(&l->querysig);
3858 }
3859 result = dns_message_getquerytsig(msg, mctx, &l->querysig);
3860 check_result(result,"dns_message_getquerytsig");
3861 }
3862
3863 extrabytes = isc_buffer_remaininglength(&b);
3864
3865 debug("after parse");
3866 if (l->doing_xfr && l->xfr_q == NULL) {
3867 l->xfr_q = query;
3868 /*
3869 * Once we are in the XFR message, increase
3870 * the timeout to much longer, so brief network
3871 * outages won't cause the XFR to abort
3872 */
3873 if (timeout != INT_MAX && query->timer != NULL) {
3874 unsigned int local_timeout;
3875
3876 if (timeout == 0) {
3877 if (l->tcp_mode)
3878 local_timeout = TCP_TIMEOUT * 4;
3879 else
3880 local_timeout = UDP_TIMEOUT * 4;
3881 } else {
3882 if (timeout < (INT_MAX / 4))
3883 local_timeout = timeout * 4;
3884 else
3885 local_timeout = INT_MAX;
3886 }
3887 debug("have local timeout of %d", local_timeout);
3888 isc_interval_set(&l->interval, local_timeout, 0);
3889 result = isc_timer_reset(query->timer,
3890 isc_timertype_once,
3891 NULL,
3892 &l->interval,
3893 false);
3894 check_result(result, "isc_timer_reset");
3895 }
3896 }
3897
3898 if (!done_process_opt) {
3899 if (l->cookie != NULL) {
3900 if (msg->opt == NULL) {
3901 printf(";; expected opt record in response\n");
3902 } else {
3903 process_opt(l, msg);
3904 }
3905 } else if (l->sendcookie && msg->opt != NULL) {
3906 process_opt(l, msg);
3907 }
3908 }
3909 if (!l->doing_xfr || l->xfr_q == query) {
3910 if (msg->rcode == dns_rcode_nxdomain &&
3911 (l->origin != NULL || l->need_search)) {
3912 if (!next_origin(query->lookup) || showsearch) {
3913 dighost_printmessage(query, msg, true);
3914 dighost_received(isc_buffer_usedlength(&b),
3915 &sevent->address, query);
3916 }
3917 } else if (!l->trace && !l->ns_search_only) {
3918 dighost_printmessage(query, msg, true);
3919 } else if (l->trace) {
3920 int nl = 0;
3921 int count = msg->counts[DNS_SECTION_ANSWER];
3922
3923 debug("in TRACE code");
3924 if (!l->ns_search_only)
3925 dighost_printmessage(query, msg, true);
3926
3927 l->rdtype = l->qrdtype;
3928 if (l->trace_root || (l->ns_search_only && count > 0)) {
3929 if (!l->trace_root)
3930 l->rdtype = dns_rdatatype_soa;
3931 nl = followup_lookup(msg, query,
3932 DNS_SECTION_ANSWER);
3933 l->trace_root = false;
3934 } else if (count == 0)
3935 nl = followup_lookup(msg, query,
3936 DNS_SECTION_AUTHORITY);
3937 if (nl == 0)
3938 docancel = true;
3939 } else {
3940 debug("in NSSEARCH code");
3941
3942 if (l->trace_root) {
3943 /*
3944 * This is the initial NS query.
3945 */
3946 int nl;
3947
3948 l->rdtype = dns_rdatatype_soa;
3949 nl = followup_lookup(msg, query,
3950 DNS_SECTION_ANSWER);
3951 if (nl == 0)
3952 docancel = true;
3953 l->trace_root = false;
3954 usesearch = false;
3955 } else {
3956 dighost_printmessage(query, msg, true);
3957 }
3958 }
3959 }
3960
3961 if (l->pending)
3962 debug("still pending.");
3963 if (l->doing_xfr) {
3964 if (query != l->xfr_q) {
3965 dns_message_destroy(&msg);
3966 isc_event_free(&event);
3967 query->waiting_connect = false;
3968 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
3969 return;
3970 }
3971 if (!docancel)
3972 docancel = check_for_more_data(query, msg, sevent);
3973 if (docancel) {
3974 dns_message_destroy(&msg);
3975 clear_query(query);
3976 cancel_lookup(l);
3977 check_next_lookup(l);
3978 }
3979 } else {
3980
3981 if (msg->rcode == dns_rcode_noerror || l->origin == NULL) {
3982 dighost_received(isc_buffer_usedlength(&b),
3983 &sevent->address, query);
3984 }
3985
3986 if (!query->lookup->ns_search_only)
3987 query->lookup->pending = false;
3988 if (!query->lookup->ns_search_only ||
3989 query->lookup->trace_root || docancel)
3990 {
3991 dns_message_destroy(&msg);
3992 cancel_lookup(l);
3993 }
3994 clear_query(query);
3995 check_next_lookup(l);
3996 }
3997 if (msg != NULL) {
3998 dns_message_destroy(&msg);
3999 }
4000 isc_event_free(&event);
4001 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
4002 return;
4003
4004 udp_mismatch:
4005 isc_buffer_invalidate(&query->recvbuf);
4006 isc_buffer_init(&query->recvbuf, query->recvspace, COMMSIZE);
4007 isc_buffer_availableregion(&query->recvbuf, &r);
4008 result = isc_socket_recv(query->sock, &r, 1,
4009 global_task, recv_done, query);
4010 check_result(result, "isc_socket_recv");
4011 recvcount++;
4012 isc_event_free(&event);
4013 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
4014 return;
4015}
4016
4017/*%
4018 * Turn a name into an address, using system-supplied routines. This is
4019 * used in looking up server names, etc... and needs to use system-supplied
4020 * routines, since they may be using a non-DNS system for these lookups.
4021 */
4022isc_result_t
4023get_address(char *host, in_port_t myport, isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr) {
4024 int count;
4025 isc_result_t result;
4026 bool is_running;
4027
4028 is_running = isc_app_isrunning();
4029 if (is_running)
4030 isc_app_block();
4031 result = bind9_getaddresses(host, myport, sockaddr, 1, &count);
4032 if (is_running)
4033 isc_app_unblock();
4034 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
4035 return (result);
4036
4037 INSIST(count == 1);
4038
4039 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
4040}
4041
4042int
4043getaddresses(dig_lookup_t *lookup, const char *host, isc_result_t *resultp) {
4044 isc_result_t result;
4045 isc_sockaddr_t sockaddrs[DIG_MAX_ADDRESSES];
4046 isc_netaddr_t netaddr;
4047 int count, i;
4048 dig_server_t *srv;
4049 char tmp[ISC_NETADDR_FORMATSIZE];
4050
4051 result = bind9_getaddresses(host, 0, sockaddrs,
4052 DIG_MAX_ADDRESSES, &count);
4053 if (resultp != NULL)
4054 *resultp = result;
4055 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
4056 if (resultp == NULL)
4057 fatal("couldn't get address for '%s': %s",
4058 host, isc_result_totext(result));
4059 return (0);
4060 }
4061
4062 for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
4063 isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(&netaddr, &sockaddrs[i]);
4064 isc_netaddr_format(&netaddr, tmp, sizeof(tmp));
4065 srv = make_server(tmp, host);
4066 ISC_LIST_APPEND(lookup->my_server_list, srv, link);
4067 }
4068
4069 return (count);
4070}
4071
4072/*%
4073 * Initiate either a TCP or UDP lookup
4074 */
4075void
4076do_lookup(dig_lookup_t *lookup) {
4077 dig_query_t *query;
4078
4079 REQUIRE(lookup != NULL);
4080
4081 debug("do_lookup()");
4082 lookup->pending = true;
4083 query = ISC_LIST_HEAD(lookup->q);
4084 if (query != NULL) {
4085 REQUIRE(DIG_VALID_QUERY(query));
4086 if (lookup->tcp_mode)
4087 send_tcp_connect(query);
4088 else
4089 send_udp(query);
4090 }
4091}

4093/*%
4094 * Start everything in action upon task startup.
4095 */
4096void
4097onrun_callback(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event) {
4098 UNUSED(task);
4099
4100 isc_event_free(&event);
4101 LOCK_LOOKUP;
4102 start_lookup();
4103 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
4104}

4106/*%
4107 * Make everything on the lookup queue go away. Mainly used by the
4108 * SIGINT handler.
4109 */
4110void
4111cancel_all(void) {
4112 dig_lookup_t *l, *n;
4113 dig_query_t *q, *nq;
4114
4115 debug("cancel_all()");
4116
4117 LOCK_LOOKUP;
4118 if (free_now) {
4119 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
4120 return;
4121 }
4122 cancel_now = true;
4123 if (current_lookup != NULL) {
4124 for (q = ISC_LIST_HEAD(current_lookup->q);
4125 q != NULL;
4126 q = nq)
4127 {
4128 nq = ISC_LIST_NEXT(q, link);
4129 debug("canceling pending query %p, belonging to %p",
4130 q, current_lookup);
4131 if (q->sock != NULL)
4132 isc_socket_cancel(q->sock, NULL,
4133 ISC_SOCKCANCEL_ALL);
4134 else
4135 clear_query(q);
4136 }
4137 for (q = ISC_LIST_HEAD(current_lookup->connecting);
4138 q != NULL;
4139 q = nq)
4140 {
4141 nq = ISC_LIST_NEXT(q, clink);
4142 debug("canceling connecting query %p, belonging to %p",
4143 q, current_lookup);
4144 if (q->sock != NULL)
4145 isc_socket_cancel(q->sock, NULL,
4146 ISC_SOCKCANCEL_ALL);
4147 else
4148 clear_query(q);
4149 }
4150 }
4151 l = ISC_LIST_HEAD(lookup_list);
4152 while (l != NULL) {
4153 n = ISC_LIST_NEXT(l, link);
4154 ISC_LIST_DEQUEUE(lookup_list, l, link);
4155 try_clear_lookup(l);
4156 l = n;
4157 }
4158 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
4159}

4161/*%
4162 * Destroy all of the libs we are using, and get everything ready for a
4163 * clean shutdown.
4164 */
4165void
4166destroy_libs(void) {
4167#ifdef HAVE_LIBIDN2
4168 isc_result_t result;
4169#endif /* HAVE_LIBIDN2 */
4170
4171 if (keep != NULL)
4172 isc_socket_detach(&keep);
4173 debug("destroy_libs()");
4174 if (global_task != NULL) {
4175 debug("freeing task");
4176 isc_task_detach(&global_task);
4177 }
4178 /*
4179 * The taskmgr_destroy() call blocks until all events are cleared
4180 * from the task.
4181 */
4182 if (taskmgr != NULL) {
4183 debug("freeing taskmgr");
4184 isc_taskmgr_destroy(&taskmgr);
4185 }
4186 LOCK_LOOKUP;
4187 REQUIRE(sockcount == 0);
4188 REQUIRE(recvcount == 0);
4189 REQUIRE(sendcount == 0);
4190
4191 INSIST(ISC_LIST_HEAD(lookup_list) == NULL);
4192 INSIST(current_lookup == NULL);
4193 INSIST(!free_now);
4194
4195 free_now = true;
4196
4197 flush_server_list();
4198
4199 clear_searchlist();
4200
4201#ifdef HAVE_LIBIDN2
4202 result = dns_name_settotextfilter(NULL);
4203 check_result(result, "dns_name_settotextfilter");
4204#endif /* HAVE_LIBIDN2 */
4205 dns_name_destroy();
4206
4207 if (commctx != NULL) {
4208 debug("freeing commctx");
4209 isc_mempool_destroy(&commctx);
4210 }
4211 if (socketmgr != NULL) {
4212 debug("freeing socketmgr");
4213 isc_socketmgr_destroy(&socketmgr);
4214 }
4215 if (timermgr != NULL) {
4216 debug("freeing timermgr");
4217 isc_timermgr_destroy(&timermgr);
4218 }
4219 if (tsigkey != NULL) {
4220 debug("freeing key %p", tsigkey);
4221 dns_tsigkey_detach(&tsigkey);
4222 }
4223 if (namebuf != NULL)
4224 isc_buffer_free(&namebuf);
4225
4226 if (is_dst_up) {
4227 debug("destroy DST lib");
4228 dst_lib_destroy();
4229 is_dst_up = false;
4230 }
4231
4232 UNLOCK_LOOKUP;
4233 isc_mutex_destroy(&lookup_lock);
4234 debug("Removing log context");
4235 isc_log_destroy(&lctx);
4236
4237 debug("Destroy memory");
4238 if (memdebugging != 0)
4239 isc_mem_stats(mctx, stderr);
4240 if (mctx != NULL)
4241 isc_mem_destroy(&mctx);
4242}
4243
4244#ifdef HAVE_LIBIDN2
4245static isc_result_t
4246idn_output_filter(isc_buffer_t *buffer, unsigned int used_org) {
4247 char src[MXNAME], *dst;
4248 size_t srclen, dstlen;
4249
4250 /*
4251 * Copy name from 'buffer' to 'src' and terminate it with NULL.
4252 */
4253 srclen = isc_buffer_usedlength(buffer) - used_org;
4254 if (srclen > sizeof(src)) {
4255 warn("Input name too long to perform IDN conversion");
4256 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
4257 }
4258 memmove(src, (char *)isc_buffer_base(buffer) + used_org, srclen);
4259 src[srclen] = '\0';
4260
4261 /*
4262 * Convert 'src' to the current locale's character encoding.
4263 */
4264 idn_ace_to_locale(src, &dst);
4265
4266 /*
4267 * Check whether the converted name will fit back into 'buffer'.
4268 */
4269 dstlen = strlen(dst);
4270 if (isc_buffer_length(buffer) < used_org + dstlen) {
4271 idn2_free(dst);
4272 return (ISC_R_NOSPACE);
4273 }
4274
4275 /*
4276 * Put the converted name back into 'buffer'.
4277 */
4278 isc_buffer_subtract(buffer, srclen);
4279 memmove(isc_buffer_used(buffer), dst, dstlen);
4280 isc_buffer_add(buffer, dstlen);
4281
4282 /*
4283 * Clean up.
4284 */
4285 idn2_free(dst);
4286
4287 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
4288}
4289
4290/*%
4291 * Convert 'src', which is a string using the current locale's character
4292 * encoding, into an ACE string suitable for use in the DNS, storing the
4293 * conversion result in 'dst', which is 'dstlen' bytes large.
4294 *
4295 * 'dst' MUST be large enough to hold any valid domain name.
4296 */
4297static void
4298idn_locale_to_ace(const char *src, char *dst, size_t dstlen) {
4299 const char *final_src;
4300 char *ascii_src;
4301 int res;
4302
4303 /*
4304 * We trust libidn2 to return an error if 'src' is too large to be a
4305 * valid domain name.
4306 */
4307 res = idn2_to_ascii_lz(src, &ascii_src, IDN2_NONTRANSITIONAL);
4308 if (res != IDN2_OK) {
4309 fatal("'%s' is not a legal IDNA2008 name (%s), use +noidnin",
4310 src, idn2_strerror(res));
4311 }
4312
4313 /*
4314 * idn2_to_ascii_lz() normalizes all strings to lower case, but we
4315 * generally don't want to lowercase all input strings; make sure to
4316 * return the original case if the two strings differ only in case.
4317 */
4318 final_src = (strcasecmp(src, ascii_src) == 0 ? src : ascii_src);
4319
4320 (void)strlcpy(dst, final_src, dstlen);
4321
4322 idn2_free(ascii_src);
4323}
4324
4325/*%
4326 * Convert 'src', which is an ACE string suitable for use in the DNS, into a
4327 * string using the current locale's character encoding, storing the conversion
4328 * result in 'dst'.
4329 *
4330 * The caller MUST subsequently release 'dst' using idn2_free().
4331 */
4332static void
4333idn_ace_to_locale(const char *src, char **dst) {
4334 char *local_src, *utf8_src;
4335 int res;
4336
4337 /*
4338 * We need to:
4339 *
4340 * 1) check whether 'src' is a valid IDNA2008 name,
4341 * 2) if it is, output it in the current locale's character encoding.
4342 *
4343 * Unlike idn2_to_ascii_*(), idn2_to_unicode_*() functions are unable
4344 * to perform IDNA2008 validity checks. Thus, we need to decode any
4345 * Punycode in 'src', check if the resulting name is a valid IDNA2008
4346 * name, and only once we ensure it is, output that name in the current
4347 * locale's character encoding.
4348 *
4349 * We could just use idn2_to_unicode_8zlz() + idn2_to_ascii_lz(), but
4350 * then we would not be able to universally tell invalid names and
4351 * character encoding errors apart (if the current locale uses ASCII
4352 * for character encoding, the former function would fail even for a
4353 * valid IDNA2008 name, as long as it contained any non-ASCII
4354 * character). Thus, we need to take a longer route.
4355 *
4356 * First, convert 'src' to UTF-8, ignoring the current locale.
4357 */
4358 res = idn2_to_unicode_8z8z(src, &utf8_src, 0);
4359 if (res != IDN2_OK) {
4360 fatal("Bad ACE string '%s' (%s), use +noidnout",
4361 src, idn2_strerror(res));
4362 }
4363
4364 /*
4365 * Then, check whether decoded 'src' is a valid IDNA2008 name.
4366 */
4367 res = idn2_to_ascii_8z(utf8_src, NULL, IDN2_NONTRANSITIONAL);
4368 if (res != IDN2_OK) {
4369 fatal("'%s' is not a legal IDNA2008 name (%s), use +noidnout",
4370 src, idn2_strerror(res));
4371 }
4372
4373 /*
4374 * Finally, try converting the decoded 'src' into the current locale's
4375 * character encoding.
4376 */
4377 res = idn2_to_unicode_8zlz(utf8_src, &local_src, 0);
4378 if (res != IDN2_OK) {
4379 fatal("Cannot represent '%s' in the current locale (%s), "
4380 "use +noidnout or a different locale",
4381 src, idn2_strerror(res));
4382 }
4383
4384 /*
4385 * Free the interim conversion result.
4386 */
4387 idn2_free(utf8_src);
4388
4389 *dst = local_src;
4390}
4391#endif /* HAVE_LIBIDN2 */
